description: Keir Starmer used his biggest international summit since becoming prime minister to say Britain was back and “looking outward to the world again.” Asserting a global role for his government proved more elusive.
title: Starmer Struggles to Find Voice for UK in More Hostile World

description: Linda McMahon is expected to be named as President-elect Trump’s nominee for education secretary, CNN reports, citing people familiar with the matter.
title: Linda McMahon Expected to Be Nominated for Education Chief: CNN

description: Four years ago, President Joe Biden declared “America’s back” and told his fellow world leaders that Donald Trump had been an aberration.
title: In Brazil, Biden Fades Out Into Amazon Jungle

description: Jimmy Lai, the biggest target in Hong Kong’s crackdown on dissent, will take the stand to defend himself against national security charges that could silence the 76-year-old for the rest of his life.
title: Jimmy Lai to Take Stand in Hong Kong, Breaking Four-Year Silence

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior correspondent Saleha Mohsin looks at the slowed down process for picking a Treasury secretary. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Treasury Secretary Drama Extending for Another Act

description: This week, Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva was supposed to cement his status as the preeminent leader of the developing world.
title: Lula’s G-20 Moment Slips Away and His Problems Are Only Mounting

description: The UK wants the head of the World Trade Organization to be “successfully reappointed” for a second term this month, a government official said — well before a new Trump administration has a chance to weigh in on Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala’s candidacy.
title: UK Wants to See WTO Chief Reappointed Next Week, Envoy Says

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin plans to visit India for the first time since he ordered the 2022 invasion of Ukraine, a further sign of that US-led efforts to isolate him on the world stage are failing.
title: Putin Plans First India Visit Since His War in Ukraine Began

description: President-elect Donald Trump is nominating celebrity doctor and television personality Mehmet Oz to lead the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services.
title: Trump Names TV Doctor Mehmet Oz as Medicare, Medicaid Chief

description: For Xi Jinping, the main objective during two global summits was to push for a peaceful world with fewer trade barriers so he can focus on reviving China’s economy. Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin disrupted those plans.
title: Xi’s Push for Stable World of Low Tariffs Undone by Trump, Putin

description: They piled into central London in their thousands, mostly on foot but some in tractors, with placards reading “No Farmers, No Food, No Future” and “The Final Straw” to protest the new Labour government’s decision to impose inheritance tax on farms for the first time in over three decades.
title: Farmers Protest Starmer Tax Raid Piling on Post-Brexit Misery

description: President-elect Donald Trump has yet to announce his pick for Treasury secretary, but Kevin Warsh — a former Federal Reserve board member well known to Wall Street — has at least won some backing in the bond market.
title: Warsh Seen by Markets as Seasoned Candidate to Lead US Treasury

description: Israel will pay $5 million to any Gaza resident who returns a hostage plus safe passage out of the war-ravaged territory, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Tuesday.
title: Netanyahu Offers a $5 Million Reward for Each Hostage Returned

description: Flattery will only get you so far. Don’t show weakness, never grovel, and always ask the difficult questions.
title: Can Golf Help Tame Trump at G-20? The Next Host Is Already Asking

description: President-elect Donald Trump is tapping Cantor Fitzgerald LP chief executive officer Howard Lutnick to lead the Commerce Department, a central pick in an administration that will likely be shaped by sweeping tariff hike proposals.
title: Trump Picks Cantor Fitzgerald’s Lutnick as Commerce Chief

description: The Biden administration is beginning to refer to Edmundo González Urrutia as Venezuela’s president-elect, a senior administration official said, its strongest acknowledgment yet that the opposition candidate won July’s presidential election.
title: US Is Now Calling González the President-Elect of Venezuela

description: A distinctive feature of Russia’s military tactics has been that it doesn’t rule out using nuclear weapons in a conventional war.
title: What’s Russia’s Nuclear Doctrine and How Did Putin Change It?

description: A top Nippon Steel Corp. executive is set to meet Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, an ally of President Joe Biden, to tout how his company’s proposed $14.1 billion takeover of United States Steel Corp. could benefit the state.
title: Nippon Steel’s Mori to Meet With Pennsylvania Governor Shapiro

description: High public debt can’t be left to fester in the US and its peers in a world that is prone to more pandemics than before, former Reserve Bank of India governor Raghuram Rajan said.
title: Curb Your Debts to Prepare for the Next Pandemic, Rajan Tells US

description: Croatian Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic said the first round of presidential elections will take place on Dec. 29, the state news agency Hina reported Tuesday.
title: Croatia to Hold Presidential Election Dec. 29, Hina Reports

description: Republican Representative Nancy Mace is facing criticisms of bullying and bigotry after filing a resolution that would prevent the first transgender member of the chamber, Sarah McBride, from using the women’s restroom in the Capitol — a move that’s likely a bid to appeal to Donald Trump’s conservative base.
title: Nancy Mace Called ‘Bully’ for Anti-Transgender House Resolution

description: A senior US Treasury official warned about potential risks to international financial stability and economic security from any cross-border payments systems that fail to adhere to standards aimed at minimizing illicit activity.
title: US Treasury Flags Risks in Any New Cross-Border Payments Systems

description: Canada’s budgetary watchdog says Justin Trudeau’s government has likely blown past a self-imposed fiscal guardrail, and is warning about the consequences of delaying the release of final spending and revenue numbers.
title: Trudeau Government Has Likely Blown Fiscal Anchor, Watchdog Says

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s evolving cabinet has a crucial gap as he has yet to land on a Treasury secretary to spearhead his campaign pledge to remake the economy.
title: Trump Faces Treasury-Sized Hole in Cabinet as He Ponders Choices

description: Keir Starmer should be prepared to use populist Reform UK leader Nigel Farage as a “bridgehead” to working with US President-elect Donald Trump, according to a key ally of the British prime minister who’s tipped to become the UK’s next ambassador to Washington.
title: Starmer Ally Mandelson Sees Room for Farage in Trump Outreach

description: Intuit Inc. and H&R Block Inc. shares fell on Tuesday, after the Washington Post reported that the leaders of President-elect Donald Trump’s “Department of Government Efficiency” discussed creating a new way for Americans to file their taxes.
title: Intuit and H&R Block Fall on Report of ‘DOGE’ Interest in Tax App

description: Martin Gruenberg, the head of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp., will step down on Jan. 19.
title: Embattled FDIC Chair to Leave Agency on Eve of Inauguration

description: Officials in Springfield, Ohio, say they can’t predict how quickly President-elect Donald Trump might act on his campaign promise to deport Haitian migrants, but they are already bracing for the economic impact.
title: Trump’s Deportation Threat Puts Haitians in Springfield on Edge

description: French and Polish agriculture ministers will meet in Warsaw in the coming days to discuss their respective lists of objections to a trade deal between the European Union and Latin America’s Mercosur bloc, Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski said on Tuesday.
title: Poland, France to Discuss Concerns Over Mercosur Trade Deal

description: Ukraine’s new agriculture minister said that the European Union should support his country’s farmers and not treat them as a threat to their counterparts in the bloc.
title: Ukraine’s Farmers Aren’t Threat to EU, Agriculture Minister Says

description: Russia’s central bank set the ruble’s exchange rate at more than 100 per US dollar for the first time in more than a year after Ukraine used US-supplied missiles to strike in Russia for the the first time.
title: Russian Ruble Falls to 13-Month Low After Ukraine Missile Strike

description: Iran has agreed to stop producing uranium enriched close to the level required for nuclear weapons, a sign the Islamic Republic may be ready to resolve a standoff with the West over its atomic activities.
title: Iran to Stop Producing Near Bomb-Grade Uranium, IAEA Says

description: President-elect Donald Trump is expected to name Howard Lutnick as Commerce Secretary, Punchbowl reports, citing people close to the process.
title: Trump Expected to Name Lutnick as Commerce Chief, Punchbowl Says

description: Donald Trump’s Nov. 26 sentencing in his New York hush money case was adjourned by the court as the judge weighs how to handle the prosecution in the wake of the former president’s reelection victory.
title: Trump’s Nov. 26 Hush Money Sentencing Called Off, Court Says

description: Vladimir Putin’s war on Ukraine is escalating after months of bloody attrition.
title: Russia’s War Against Ukraine Is Entering Dangerous New Phase

description: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk defended embattled former Representative Matt Gaetz, President-elect Donald Trump’s pick for attorney general, in the face of scrutiny from Republicans over a House sexual misconduct probe that threatens to upend his confirmation.
title: Musk Defends Gaetz as House Faces Pressure to Share Ethics Probe

description: Brazil’s federal police arrested five people for allegedly plotting to kill President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, his vice president and a top judge as part of a 2022 coup attempt.
title: Brazil Arrests Five in Alleged 2022 Plot to Kill Lula and Stage Coup

description: The US sees no reason to adjust its nuclear posture in response to Russia’s decision to lower the threshold for using atomic weapons, a National Security Council spokesperson said.
title: US Won’t Adjust Posture After Russia Lowers Nuclear Threshold

description: South Africa’s Treasury plans to withhold funds from five municipalities next month over their unpaid water bills, part of an effort to compel local governments to pay for basic services.
title: South Africa Treasury to Suspend Municipal Funds Over Water Debt

description: Most German lawmakers want the country to supply Ukraine with Taurus long-range missiles, according to former Deputy Finance Minister Florian Toncar.
title: Majority Wants German Taurus Missiles for Ukraine, Lawmaker Says

description: A spokesman for German Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s Social Democrats denied a report that the party will hold an emergency meeting Tuesday to discuss if Scholz should be the party’s chancellor candidate.
title: SPD Denies Report on Crisis Meeting to Discuss Scholz Prospects

description: The European Union will move ahead “swiftly” with an initial phase of accession talks for Ukraine and Moldova during the first half of 2025 under Poland’s rotating presidency of the bloc, according to a senior official in Warsaw.
title: EU to Move on Ukraine, Moldova Accession, Polish Official Says

description: California Governor Gavin Newsom is vowing to pursue “Trump-proofing” and has said “the freedoms we hold dear in California are under attack — and we won’t sit idle.” Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker proclaimed that “you come for my people, you come through me.” And from Los Angeles to Chicago to Boston, Democratic mayors have declared that they’re ready to fight to protect vulnerable residents.
title: NYC’s Mayor Chooses Fight Night With Trump Over Fighting Talk

description: “It’s a lot of just trying to mitigate harm.”
title: Companies With Immigrant Workforces Are Preparing for Raids
Tensions Surge in Russia-Ukraine War as G-20 Meets

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Ukraine Strike and Putin Threat Stoke Tensions

description: We have handed power to those who want us more alone, more deceived and more divided.
title: Trump Is Selling the Wrong Idea of Freedom, Says Author of On Tyranny

description: Dueling ballot measures in Nebraska left voters confused.
title: The Future of Abortion Rights Could Be Decided by Accident

description: Western ports, which mostly serve India and Turkey, bear the brunt of the drop
title: Russia’s Crude Exports Slump to the Lowest Since September

description: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said damage to two undersea data cables in the Baltic Sea has to be investigated as an act of sabotage, pointing to Russia as posing a hybrid and military threat to the European Union.
title: German Defense Chief Sees Cable Breaches in Baltic as Sabotage

description: Ukraine warned New Delhi that Russian firms are setting up fronts in India to skirt US sanctions, a development that could hurt India’s ties with Western partners wary of technology and weapons falling into the hands of Moscow.
title: Ukraine Warns India That Russia Trade Puts Western Ties at Risk

description: Executives say his preoccupation with the stock market will override his economically dangerous ideas.
title: Wall Street Is Too Pumped About Trump to Worry About His Policies

description: One of Joe Biden’s main Middle East envoys landed in Beirut on Tuesday morning, as the US steps up efforts to clinch a cease-fire between Lebanese militant group Hezbollah and Israel.
title: US Pushes for Israel-Hezbollah Truce With Envoy Visit to Beirut

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said he expressed his desire to strengthen his nation’s alliance with the US during a phone call Tuesday with President-elect Donald Trump.
title: Marcos Discusses Philippine-US Ties, Imelda in Call With Trump

description: After pro-democracy protests rocked Hong Kong in 2019, mainland China tightened its grip by imposing a broad national security law on the former British colony. Since then, dozens of opposition figures — including former media tycoon Jimmy Lai — have been jailed while awaiting trial. More than 40 people were later convicted and sentenced in November 2024. News outlets have been shut and teachers disciplined. President Xi Jinping has made his aim clear: Hong Kong should be in the hands of “patrio
title: How China’s National Security Law Changed Hong Kong

description: Ukraine has been pleading with the US for months to let it use American-made weapons to hit military targets inside Russia beyond the border zone. Now, as he nears the end of his presidency, Joe Biden has relented and decided to lift some restrictions, according to people familiar with the decision.
title: Why US Will Let Ukraine Strike Inside Russia With American Missiles

description: Police broke up an opposition camp in the center of Georgia’s capital, Tbilisi, and began detaining protesters demanding new parliamentary elections.
title: Georgian Police Break Up Opposition Protest Camp in Tbilisi

description: An opposition leader won elections in the semi-autonomous region of Somaliland, beating incumbent President Muse Bihi Abdi.
title: Breakaway Somalia Region Elects Opposition Leader as President

description: Indonesia will discuss reviving its tax amnesty program next year as President Prabowo Subianto’s government seeks ways to boost state revenue and broaden the tax base.
title: Indonesia May Revive Tax Amnesty to Lift Revenue, Widen Tax Base

description: Japan’s ruling party named Daishiro Yamagiwa as the new chairman of its group that promotes semiconductors, as it sets up a new mechanism to boost funding for the key industry.
title: Japan’s LDP Names Former Minister Yamagiwa as Chip Czar

description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said the country wants to restore direct flights with India, as tensions between the two Asian neighbors dial down following a four-year impasse on border disputes.
title: China Seeks to Resume Direct Flights With India as Tensions Ease

description: Germany’s Scholz showed the way with feckless outreach to Putin.
title: Ukraine’s Allies Are Inviting Their Own ‘Strategic Defeat’

description: Key European countries may need to double defense spending to meet the challenge of Russia’s aggression in Ukraine as well as the possibility of less American support in a Donald Trump presidency, according to a Bloomberg Intelligence report.
title: Europe May Need $720 Billion in Defense Spending, Analysts Say

description: China said an SUV rammed into a crowd at a primary school, leaving multiple people injured — an incident that comes with the nation on edge due to a string of violent attacks.
title: China Says SUV Plowed Into Crowd of People Outside a School

description: South Korea’s household debt grew the most in three years last quarter, highlighting a development that kept the central bank from pivoting on policy until last month.
title: South Korea’s Household Debt Rose Most Last Quarter Since 2021

description: TAIPEI, Taiwan (AP) — Numerous children were injured by a vehicle at the gate of an elementary school in central China’s Hunan province on Tuesday morning, reports said.
title: Numerous Children Injured by a Vehicle at School Gate in China

description: Lebanon and the Hezbollah militia have reached agreement on a US plan for a cease-fire with Israel, Reuters reported on Monday.
title: Lebanon, Hezbollah Agree to US Cease-Fire Plan, Reuters Says
